title._content: On the second day of battle, news artist Alfred Waud portrayed a major Confederate attack by the Louisiana Tigers at Cemetery Hill (LOC)

description._content: Waud, Alfred R., 1828-1891,, artist. Attack of the Louisiana Tigers on a battery of the 11th Corps [1863 July 2] 1 drawing on olive paper : pencil, Chinese white, and black ink wash ; 34.6 x 22.1 cm. (sheet). Notes: Title inscribed below image. Pencil grid drawn for engraver. Inscribed upper left: 1/2 page. Inscribed on verso: The sketch represented it as too dark. Gift, J.P. Morgan, 1919 (DLC/PP-1919:R2.2.533) Forms part of: Morgan collection of Civil War drawings. Published in: Harper's Weekly, August 8, 1863. Published in: Harper's Weekly, August 8, 1863. Published in: Civil War Sketch Book by Harry L. Katz and Vincent Virga. New York: W.W. Norton, 2012, p. 120. Subjects: LSU Tigers (Football team)--1860-1870. Gettysburg, Battle of, Gettysburg, Pa., 1863. Artillery (Weaponry)--1860-1870. Forts & fortifications--1860-1870. Soldiers--Union--1860-1870. Soldiers--Confederate--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Campaigns & battles. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Casualties. XI Corps. United States--Pennsylvania--Gettysburg Format: Drawings--American--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Part Of: Morgan collection of Civil War drawings (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2003691200 Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.21454 Call Number: DRWG/US - Waud, no. 533
